channel.title: No clip always on? >:(
channel.description:
No clip is always on on my source. I have no clue how to fix this.
And I would also like for it to autoban people who try ::noclip
OR
Just take ::noclip out altogether.
Thanks - Incog

item.title: No clip always on? >:(
item.dc:creator: @Incognito4 Incognito4
item.description:
@Incognito4 wrote:

I Vain I:

I don’t do 500+.

What source do you recommend for first server? / I want a good PKing server with a good base.

Best option?

Read full topic

item.title: No clip always on? >:(
item.dc:creator: @Incognito4 Incognito4
item.description:
@Incognito4 wrote:

I Vain I:

You need to load the cached objects through the stream loader, and then add them as objects, and write your own clipping formula.

No idea how to do any of that… ^

First real server…

Could you help mate?

Read full topic

item.title: No clip always on? >:(

item.description:
@Incognito4 wrote:

Mendorphins:

If he means the 562’s, they don’t load the map objects so you can just walk straight through them as if they weren’t there.

What should I do then?

item.title: No clip always on? >:(
item.dc:creator: @jakanddax222 jakanddax222
item.description:
@jakanddax222 wrote:

the ::noclip command is not in your server/source files. its in the client files NOT client.java in your source, if you have a premade client i dont think you can change it unless you get whoever is making the premade clients to change it around a bit.

Read full topic

And I would also like for it to autoban people who try ::noclip

OR

Just take ::noclip out altogether.

Thanks - Incog
[/quote]
If you have the code “noclip” just delete the code.[/quote]

I can’t find client.java, and you do you know how to like update your friends server without going to their house?

item.title: No clip always on? >:(
item.dc:creator: @jakanddax222 jakanddax222
item.description:
@jakanddax222 wrote:

do you have a premade webclient (like from rs-ps.org)? if so sorry i dont think you can change that, but if you have a download client or your own webclient that you made, in the client folder, look for client.java, the ::noclip command is in their, just use the find button to change the name of it ( like i did) or completely delete it so no one can use it, hope this helped =D sorry if it didnt

Read full topic
